citations.narrative:
A current record of guinea pigs was not available for review during this inspection. A total of 247 guinea pigs were
counted at time of inspection. There were no inventory records kept including the number of adult guinea pigs, weanlings,
newborns present for the last 4 months or records kept on animals that died since August. Failure to maintain these
records can make it difficult to assess the health of the caviary by identifying animal losses by death or decreased number
of animals born, raised, or sold. Licensee must maintain records containing the required information for animals which
disclose the number of guinea pigs held, owned, acquired or disposed of including births and deaths. Correct by
December 9, 2023.

There were accumulations of feces and soiled bedding in the majority of the guinea pigs enclosures. Licensee stated that
the enclosures were last cleaned 2 weeks ago. Accumulations of feces and soiled bedding can expose the guinea pigs to
disease hazards such as bacterial and fugal diseases. The cleaning process(method and frequency) utilized is not
effective in removing accumulations inside the enclosures. Licensee must ensure that enclosures are cleaned often
enough to prevent accumulations of excreta and spoiled bedding, and that enclosures are sanitized at least once every 2
weeks. Correct by December 5, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
